isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - MAINSHAFT

step1.para: Move the countershaft forward as far as possible and block it to the side by inserting a large screwdriver or prybar between the main drive gear and the countershaft ( Figure 143).

note.para: Make sure the input shaft is pulled forward before positioning the mainshaft.

step1.para: Hold the reverse gear against the next gear, and lower the mainshaft assembly into position while guiding the shaft rear through the case bore. A mainshaft hook or piece of rope can be used to hold on to the mainshaft ( Figure 143).

figure.caption: Figure 143. Move Countershaft Forward and Lower Mainshaft Assembly into Position

step1.para: Move the mainshaft forward to position the mainshaft pilot end into the rear of the input shaft.

Install the reverse idler bearing and inner race into the reverse idler gear, and place the gear in its approximate location. Rest it against the case wall, but do not install the reverse idler shaft yet.
Slide the mainshaft reverse gear rearward ( Figure 144).

figure.caption: Figure 144. Slide Mainshaft Reverse Gear Rearward

step1.para: Install the tanged washer into the reverse gear ( Figure 145).
Install the snap ring into the reverse gear ( Figure 145).
If previously removed, press the inner spacer into the mainshaft rear bearing.

Slide the mainshaft rear bearing and splined spacer over the mainshaft, and seat the bearing with a soft hammer on maul. You may need to lift the rear of the mainshaft slightly to be able to fit the bearing into the case bore.

figure.caption: Figure 145. Install Tanged Washer and Snap Ring
